Package simulation.montecarlo

Class singleSpin

java.lang.Object
simulation.montecarlo.singleSpin
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class singleSpin extends Object implements Serializable
A single spin object
See Also:
Serialized Form

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    private double
    localBx
    local applied magnetic field in the x direction (transverse)
    private double
    localBy
    local applied magnetic field in the y direction (transverse)
    private double
    localBz
    local applied magnetic field in the z direction (longitudinal) which is defined as the easy axis
    private int
    n
    the spin's ordinal number within its lattice.
    private int[][]
    prevBIndices
    first array contains the last indices of the local field (x,y,z) == (2,1,0) in the FieldTable second array is used to track whether consecutive calls (to find magneticMoment or energy) are correlated (separately for x,y,z) with 1 indicating correlation and 0 indicating otherwise.
    private int
    s
    spin orientation: up=+1 and down=-1
    private static long
    serialVersionUID
     
    private double
    spinSize
    the magnetic moment of the ion (can change depending on the applied field)

  • Field Details

    • serialVersionUID

      private static final long serialVersionUID
      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

    • s

      private int s
      spin orientation: up=+1 and down=-1

    • spinSize

      private double spinSize
      the magnetic moment of the ion (can change depending on the applied field)

    • localBz

      private double localBz
      local applied magnetic field in the z direction (longitudinal) which is defined as the easy axis

    • n

      private int n
      the spin's ordinal number within its lattice.
      See Also:
      Lattice.generateIsingLattice(int, int, double, boolean[])

    • localBx

      private double localBx
      local applied magnetic field in the x direction (transverse)

    • localBy

      private double localBy
      local applied magnetic field in the y direction (transverse)

    • prevBIndices

      private int[][] prevBIndices
      first array contains the last indices of the local field (x,y,z) == (2,1,0) in the FieldTable second array is used to track whether consecutive calls (to find magneticMoment or energy) are correlated (separately for x,y,z) with 1 indicating correlation and 0 indicating otherwise.

  • Constructor Details

    • singleSpin

      public singleSpin()
      Constructs an empty singleSpin object with spin up and 0 in all other fields.

    • singleSpin

      public singleSpin​(int s0, int n0, double localBz, double localBy, double localBx, double spinSize0)
      Constructs a singleSpin object with the given parameters and without knowing the previous B indices
      Parameters:
      s0 - spin orientation (+1 for up, -1 for down)
      n0 - spin index (ordinal number)
      localBz - local magnetic field in the z direction
      localBy - local magnetic field in the y direction
      localBx - local magnetic field in the x direction
      spinSize0 - magnetic moment of this spin (ion)
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the given spin orientation is different than -1, 0 or +1.

    • singleSpin

      public singleSpin​(int s0, int n0, double localBz, double localBy, double localBx, double spinSize0, int[][] prevBIndices0)
      Constructs a singleSpin object with the given parameters, including the prevBindices array
      Parameters:
      s0 - spin orientation (+1 for up, -1 for down)
      n0 - spin index (ordinal number)
      localBz - local magnetic field in the z direction
      localBy - local magnetic field in the y direction
      localBx - local magnetic field in the x direction
      spinSize0 - magnetic moment of this spin (ion)
      prevBIndices0 - array of the indices of the magnetic field (in the FieldTable object) from the last calculation they will be deep copies to this new object.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if the received prevBIndices0 is null
      IllegalArgumentException - if the received prevBIndices0 is not of the right size

    • singleSpin

      public singleSpin​(int s0, int n0)
      Constructs a singleSpin object with the given parameters w/o an applied field or spinSize
      Parameters:
      s0 - spin orientation (+1 for up, -1 for down)
      n0 - spin index (ordinal number)

    • singleSpin

      public singleSpin​(int s0, int n0, double spinSize)
      Constructs a singleSpin object with the given parameters w/o an applied field
      Parameters:
      s0 - spin orientation (+1 for up, -1 for down)
      n0 - spin index (ordinal number)
      spinSize - the positive magnetic moment size (the sign will be determined according to the given s0)

    • singleSpin

      public singleSpin​(singleSpin other)
      Copies a singleSpin object
      Parameters:
      other - Another singleSpin object to (deep) copy

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Prints the singleSpin object
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      a string containing the data in this object in the following form: "Spin:-1 Number: 25 Local Bz: -0.2 Local By: 1.2 Local Bx: 0.04 Spin Size: 5.51"

    • distance

      public double[] distance​(singleSpin another, int Lz, int Lx)
      Calculates the distance between two spins with (naive) periodic boundary conditions
      Parameters:
      another - spin to which the distance will be calculated
      Lx - number of unit cells in the x-direction
      Lz - number of unit cells in the z-direction
      Returns:
      array of the form [ds,dx,dx,dz] where, ds = total Euclidean distance dx = Euclidean distance along the x direction dy = Euclidean distance along the y direction dz = Euclidean distance along the z direction
      See Also:
      periodic boundary conditions wiki

    • flipSpin

      public void flipSpin()
      Flip this spin and indicate no correlation is expected in the next FieldTable calculation

    • calcDipolarInteraction

      @Deprecated public double calcDipolarInteraction​(singleSpin o, int Lz, int Lx)
      Deprecated.
      because the diplor interaction is now calculated using the Ewlad method and read to an interactions table
      Calculates the (naive) dipolar interaction between two spins
      Parameters:
      o - spin with which the dipolar interaction will be calculated
      Lz - number of unit cells in the z direction
      Lx - number of unit cells in the x and y directions
      Returns:
      the dipolar interaction between this and the given singleSpin

    • getLocation

      public org.apache.commons.math3.geometry.euclidean.threed.Vector3D getLocation​(int Lz, int Ly)
      Gets the location of this spin as a Vector3D object. Uses the spins ordinal index number
      Parameters:
      Lz - number of unit cells in the z direction of the system
      Ly - number of unit cells in the y direction of the system
      Returns:
      a 3D vector which indicates the location of this spin

    • getX

      public double getX​(int Lz, int Ly)
      Gets the x component of the location of this spin Uses the spins ordinal index number
      Parameters:
      Lz - number of unit cells in the z direction of the system
      Ly - number of unit cells in the y direction of the system
      Returns:
      the x component of the location of this spin

    • getY

      public double getY​(int Lz, int Ly)
      Gets the y component of the location of this spin Uses the spins ordinal index number
      Parameters:
      Lz - number of unit cells in the z direction of the system
      Ly - number of unit cells in the y direction of the system
      Returns:
      the y component of the location of this spin

    • getZ

      public double getZ​(int Lz, int Ly)
      Gets the z component of the location of this spin Uses the spins ordinal index number
      Parameters:
      Lz - number of unit cells in the z direction of the system
      Ly - number of unit cells in the y direction of the system
      Returns:
      the z component of the location of this spin
